ERP Microservices
Table of Contents

Namespace MyApp.Shared.Domain.Permissions

Classes

PermissionConstants

Provides predefined permission constants for all module and action combinations. These constants can be used in authorization policies and permission checks.

Usage:

[Authorize(Roles = "Admin")]
[Permission(PermissionConstants.Inventory.Read)]
public IActionResult GetProducts() => Ok();
PermissionConstants.Auth

Auth module permissions

PermissionConstants.Billing

Billing module permissions

PermissionConstants.Inventory

Inventory module permissions

PermissionConstants.Notification

Notification module permissions

PermissionConstants.Orders

Orders module permissions

PermissionConstants.Permissions

Permissions management permissions

PermissionConstants.Purchasing

Purchasing module permissions

PermissionConstants.Roles

Roles management permissions

PermissionConstants.Sales

Sales module permissions

PermissionConstants.Users

Users management permissions

PermissionEnum

Represents a permission as a combination of a module and an action. Example: Inventory.Read, Purchasing.Write, Orders.Delete

Usage:

var permission = new PermissionEnum 
{ 
    Module = ModuleEnum.Inventory, 
    Action = ActionEnum.Read 
};
string permissionString = permission.ToString(); // "Inventory.Read"

Enums

ActionEnum

Enumerates all permission actions that can be performed in the ERP system. These actions represent CRUD operations and other common actions.

ModuleEnum

Enumerates all modules in the ERP system. Each module represents a functional area like Inventory, Purchasing, etc.

ERP Microservices - A cloud-native ERP system built with .NET 9
